description: Triangle T(n,k), n >= 0, in which n-th row (for n >= 3) lists prime factors of Fibonacci(n) (see A000045), without repetition.
comments: Rows have irregular lengths.T(n,k) = A027748(A000045(n),k), k = 1 .. A022307(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 30 2014
links: T. D. Noe, Rows n=0..1000 of triangle, flattened (using Blair Kelly's data)
maple: with(numtheory): with(combinat): for i from 3 to 50 do for j from 1 to nops(ifactors(fibonacci(i))[2]) do printf(`%d,`, ifactors(fibonacci(i))[2][j][1]) od: od:
prog: (Haskell)a060442 n k = a060442_tabf !! n !! ka060442_row n = a060442_tabf !! na060442_tabf = [0] : [1] : [1] : map a027748_row (drop 3 a000045_list)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 30 2014
crossrefs: For n>2, the length of row n is A022307(n).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 07 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 09 2001
